title: Sr. Design Engineer
description:
About Us

For over 145 years, Ingersoll Rand has provided a wide range of technologically advanced, highly reliable and low maintenance air compressors. We have deep knowledge of the needs of the industry and the demands placed on productivity, making us leaders in the field. We stand behind our products and services and beside our customers during planning, installation, and maintenance.

Job Summary

The Sr. Design Engineer will be a member of the product development team as a mechanical design and development engineer for the rotary screw compressor portfolio. Responsibilities include all facets of the development process for a given compressor. This engineer must have the ability to multi-task but be detailed oriented, communicate effectively and work in a fast paced and dynamic environment. The engineering team is a diverse international group thus the position demands continuous interaction across multiple cultural and time zones.

Responsibilities

Key responsibilities will be for new product development projects, but as necessary will also include new technology introduction and life cycle engineering activities. Develop detailed specifications and lead product and technical design reviews. Execute to project plans, meeting schedule and cost commitments as well as customer requirements. Identify areas requiring analysis. Perform design analysis and calculations with accuracy. Follow good engineering practices and develop practical solutions. Identify multiple candidate solutions, perform trade off studies and select optimum solution based on customer requirements as defined by the product design guide. Assist designers with calculations and design. Develop test plans, work with laboratory on assembly, installation, and testing. Perform data reductions, performance calculations and create logical presentations of information in report format. Coordinate and provide technical support and assistance to other departments such as Assembly, Machining Operations, Manufacturing, Purchasing, Marketing, Quality Assurance, etc. Assist in resolving all warranty and field problems. Incorporate lessons learned from field issues into new product designs through FMEA process. 

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering is required. At least 5 years of work experience preferred. Demonstrated understanding of practical “real world” applications. Compressor or rotating machinery experience preferred but not required. Demonstrated project leadership skills. Must be team player capable of working with multiple engineering teams located in USA and India. Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills. Demonstrated proficiency in generating project plans to deliver on-time, on-cost, and on-specification. Able to work in a matrix team environment and interact with other teams Ability to create test plans and analyze test data results Experience analyzing test data and deciphering cause & effect relationships Capable of generating creative and innovative solutions to complex problems 

Travel & Work Arrangements/Requirements

Ability and willingness to travel 10-15% (primarily domestic to Ingersoll Rand testing and manufacturing facilities).

Key Competencies

Experience in industrial machine design Experience with CREO or other 3D solid modelling software Must have good presentation skills Familiar with ANSI Y14.5 drafting standards, GD&T standards, etc. Versed in various design tools related to DFSS: DFMEA, DOE, DFM&A, etc. Competent knowledge of machining and machine shop practices FEA and CFD analysis experience is a plus, but not necessary 

What We Offer

At Ingersoll Rand, we embrace a culture of personal ownership — taking responsibility for our company, our communities, and our environment, as well as our individual health and well-being. Our comprehensive benefits package is designed to empower you with the tools and support necessary to take charge of your health, ensuring that together, we can continue to make life better. Our range of benefits includes health care options like medical and prescription plans, dental and vision coverage, as well as wellness programs. Additionally, we provide life insurance, a robust 401(k) plan, paid time off, and even an employee stock grant, among other offerings. These benefits are our commitment to you, so you can be your best at work and beyond.

title: Content Marketing & Communications Manager
description: We are on the hunt for a seasoned Content Marketing and Communications Manager with a knack for creating compelling content that resonates with our target audience and excels in clear and effective communication strategies. This role is central to shaping our brand's voice, boosting our visibility, and solidifying our position as thought leaders in the industry. The ideal candidate will not only drive our content marketing efforts but also oversee our external and internal communications, ensuring a consistent message across all platforms.Key Responsibilities:· Strategize, develop, and oversee a content marketing plan that aligns with the company's objectives and target audience.· Craft engaging and informative content across various mediums - blog posts, white papers, case studies, webinars, videos, and more.· Design and implement comprehensive communications strategies that effectively convey our brand's message to diverse audiences, including media relations, social media, and public relations activities.· Collaborate closely with the growth marketing, sales, product teams, and external stakeholders to ensure content and communication consistency and alignment with campaigns.· Stay abreast of industry trends, competitor content strategies, emerging content platforms, and communication practices relevant to our domain.· Enhance brand awareness and position CG as a leading authority in the life sciences regulatory compliance niche through innovative content marketing and strategic communications.Qualifications:· Proven track record in content marketing and communications, preferably within the life sciences or regulatory compliance sectors.· Proficiency in content management systems, SEO principles, graphic design, and a strong grasp of current communication tools and platforms.· Stellar writing, editing, and communication skills, with the ability to tailor messages for different audiences and channels.· A keen eye for detail, a passion for storytelling, and a strategic mindset for planning and executing comprehensive communication strategies.· A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with industry shifts and communication trends.What We Offer:· Attractive compensation package.· A chance to work at the cutting edge of life sciences regulatory compliance.· Comprehensive benefits package.· An inclusive, vibrant, and collaborative work culture.· Opportunities for professional growth and development.

title: Therapeutic Area Manager (TAM), Ophthalmology – Eastern TN
description:
The Position

Therapeutic Area Manager (TAM), Ophthalmology – Eastern, TN

142 Million Lives were treated with our medications in 2022. Millions more lives were impacted because those people got the critical medications they needed. From the beginning, Genentech has been a team of highly dedicated, passionate individuals. We are a place where people are united around a single purpose and an ambitious vision. Together, we aspire to deliver ever better health outcomes for patients while lowering overall healthcare costs.

The Opportunity:

As a Therapeutic Area Manager Ophthalmology you will be responsible for improving the customer and patient experience in their ecosystem. You will work with experts, provide information on products, influence business strategy, and represent Genentech Ophthalmology products. You will drive on-label clinical demand, collect insights, and support the national strategy at a local level. You will follow ethical and professional standards and approved materials.

Serve as primary point of contact for customers in the therapeutic area, addressing their needs and identifying opportunities for ecosystem and therapeutic area strategies at the point-of-care.Lead end-to-end experience for assigned customers/accounts, driving clinical and non-clinical decision making at the point of care and providing education on topics ranging from clinical to non-clinical aspects.Proactively develop solutions for complex accounts within and across ecosystems, including academic, delivery network focused, and therapeutic area specific accounts.Represent Genentech products ethically and professionally, following guidelines and using approved materials.Ensure product access and provide education on product information, appropriate use, as well as on patient assistance and reimbursement resources, triaging to appropriate experts when needed.

This is a field based role, territory includes Chattanooga, Knoxville, and the Tri-Cities area. Candidates must live in the territory.

Relocation benefits are not available for this role.

Who you are:

Qualifications: 

Business, scientific or clinical degree, Bachelor’s degree level at minimum Previous cross-functional industry experience in commercial life sciences (pharma or biotechnology) or related industry engaging with key healthcare ecosystem players (e.g., payers, health systems), is required6 or more years of experience working in a sales role with HCPs, ideally representing multiple products and working across a complex healthcare system environment Demonstrated ability to coach, train, and mentor peers or others to help them meet and exceed their goals, targets, and responsibilities.

Preferred Qualifications:

Consistently achieved financial and quantitative targets, as well as qualitative goals.Proficient in addressing operational issues related to the delivery of healthcare products, including reimbursement and supply, while ensuring compliance with external laws, codes, and company policies in the healthcare industry

Complies with all laws, regulations, policies and procedures that govern the conduct of Genentech activities.

This is a field-based position.

Overnight travel may be required. This position requires significant driving of either a company provided or personal vehicle as well as prolonged periods of sitting, both of which are part of the essential duties and responsibilities of the role. As a result, Genentech, Inc. (Company) from time to time will check your motor vehicle record for purposes of determining your eligibility for driving a Company vehicle or driving any vehicle on Company business.

Genentech is an equal opportunity employer, and we embrace the increasingly diverse world around us. Genentech prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status and veteran status.

title: Accounting Manager II
description:
Job Summary (Include reference to Inventory in description?)

The NAPA Accounting Manager, Inventory leads a team in preparing and analyzing monthly, quarterly and annual financial information. This role is responsible for conducting periodic reviews on key balance sheet accounts with a primary focus on inventory and inventory valuation. This position is highly visible to corporate personnel and provides exposure to finance leadership. Ideal candidate must be able to coach, motivate and inspire supporting personnel reporting up to this position. Prior supervisory experience required. Working knowledge of PeopleSoft and comfort with exploring and using new technologies is a plus. Must exhibit critical thinking and problem-solving skills and ability to work independently. CPA Required.

Responsibilities

Assist with accounting research, documentation, and implementation of new or enhanced accounting policies and subsequently monitor adherence to such policies.Oversight of key balance sheet accounts with a primary focus on Inventory, including Inventory management, tracking and reconciliation.Provides business support to operations and advises on accounting policies and business transactions.Responsible for month-end close, ensuring the integrity of the General Ledger. Also maintaining supporting schedules or documentation associated with closing journal entries.Interface with external/internal auditors in managing requests concerning processes and deliverablesSeeks opportunities to modify or enhance current processes and ensures processes are documented and up-to-dateContribute to the preparation of GAAP financial statements, which includes document preparation, data analysis, integrity validation, and reconciliation processes.Evaluates trends, identifies and investigates unusual or unexpected account variancesEnsures targeted monthly deadlines are met and key controls are completedPromotes teamwork between operational groups and financial departments.Resolves complex accounting issues; ability to perform under pressure and multitask is essential.Actively coaches, develops and encourages team members to perform to the best of its abilitiesAssists the accounting team with monthly responsibilities, as neededMakes recommendations to resolve issues and makes corrections, as necessary

Qualifications

Bachelor degree in Accounting combined with 5 – 8 years accounting/finance experienceMinimum 3-5 years in supervisory experienceCPA certificationThorough understanding of basic accounting concepts including the balance sheet method of review.Familiarity with US GAAP and multi-entity accountingStrong analytical skills and problem-solving abilityHighly detail oriented and ability to multitask and meet assigned deadlinesCritical thinking skills with timely, effective decision makingAbility to act and operate independently with minimal daily direction from manager to accomplish objectivesExemplifies exceptional customer service and communication skills with the ability to develop and grow relationshipsMust have a strong focus on technology and experience using cloud and web based applications. Experience with Peoplesoft or Oracle is a plus.Exceptional Excel skillsStrong work ethic and a team player

Leadership

Embodies the following values: serve, perform, influence, respect, innovate, team.Effectively communicates by motivating and inspiring others through clear and proactive communication.Delivers results and drives customer success by committing and focusing on outcomes to deliver results and making the customer the center of decisions.Makes balanced decisions and thinks strategically by being a forward thinker.Develops high-performing teams by providing inclusive leadership, attracting and developing world-class talent, providing ongoing feedback, and building trust across the organization.

Physical Demands / Working Environment

Hybrid in-office schedule, currently 3 days required in officeLocated at GPC Headquarters in the Cumberland area

Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by joining our Talent Community on jobs.genpt.com or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

GPC conducts its business without regard to sex, race, creed, color, religion, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, military status, status as a veteran, or any other protected characteristic. GPC's policy is to recruit, hire, train, promote, assign, transfer and terminate employees based on their own ability, achievement, experience and conduct and other legitimate business reasons.

title: Environmental Health Safety Specialist
description:
Beyond Meat is focused on raising the bar on talent. We are dedicated to shaping an inclusive culture that drives excellence, innovation, and results by enabling talent acceleration and development, engagement, and the employee experience. The Operations Team is a matrix organization within Beyond Meat that is dedicated to creating food products that are leading the gold standard in plant-based proteins. They are looking for an outstanding individual to join the team located in El Segundo, CA as an Environmental, Health, and Safety Specialist.
The EHS Specialist is responsible for supporting improvements to Team Member’s safety performance by providing training, coordinating safety programs, and targeted EHS assessments in a Research & Development and corporate environment. They are responsible for working with team members and EHS Manager(s) to conduct EHS related training and implement SOPs. This role is a valued member of the Operations Team, working under the direction of the Manager, Facilities and Maintenance (HQ). 
TASKS, DUTIES, & GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIESProvide technical assistance on EHS compliance and EHS projects in a range of areas such as Machine Guarding, Equipment Safety, Lock Out Tag Out, Hazardous Materials, Emergency Preparedness and Response, EHS auditing, and more.Manage, supervise the implementation, training and maintenance of Beyond Meat’s Workplace Violence Plan and Injury, Illness and Prevention Plan.Manage and supervise all compliance training for California and Remote Team Members in connection with EHS matters and as required by law, including, but not limited to Beyond Meat’s Workplace Violence Plan and Injury Illness and Prevention Plan.Assist the Manager, Facilities and Maintenance in developing compliance procedures, plans, permits, and reports. Assist the Manager, Facilities and Maintenance in developing content and conducting safety training for Team Members, contractors and visitorsCoordinate and implement safety programs in support of Operations and QualityBuild strong collaborative relationships with Quality, Facilities, Commercialization and Innovation Team MembersCoordinate employee PPE programs to include boots and headgearAssist with incident investigations and contribute toward identifying and implementing root cause countermeasuresAssist with job safety analysis to proactively identify potential hazards and implement countermeasures- Identify follow-up corrective actions to close audit findingsAssists with EHS SOP implementation, document updates, and internal safety and compliance auditsAssist in managing external vendors in support of projects and programs such as CPR training, ergonomic assessments, and first aidAssist with creating, implementing, and managing programs associated with Employee Health and Safety Review company-mandated and regulatory records for completion, accuracy, and adherence to internal processesWorks with site leadership team on proactively improving the EHS Department and Corporate/R&D facility, EHS related site operations, and safety program needsAdhere to all facility policies concerning safety, security, and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs)Performs other duties, as assigned, and follows through on requests in a timely manner
QUALIFICATIONSEducation, Technical Skills, and/or Previous Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Health and Safety, Occupational Health and Safety or Related Field (An equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience in safety, environmental, and hazardous material may be considered)3+ years of experience working in an EHS role in a laboratory or food manufacturing environment 3+ years of leadership experience with training and SOP developmentExperience with Cal/OSHA, Hazardous Waste Management, and Behavioral Based Safety Programs mandatoryThorough knowledge of OSHA and EPA requirementsLeadership skills, focused on results, employee engagement, decision making, and teamwork.Ability to quantitatively review technical procedures and representative regulations Strong analytical, strategic, and critical thinking skillsExcellent verbal/written communication skills and attention to detail, with the ability to efficiently organize information, analyze large datasets, and present data in a clear and impactful manner High-level ability to build strong relationships and influence technical, business, and operational decisionsStrong multitasking skills, with the ability to work on multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced, high-growth environmentStrong Microsoft and/or Google experience; experience utilizing EPA website
WORK ENVIRONMENTOnsite 5 days a week at our El Segundo, CA Corporate and R&D HeadquartersPosition requires the ability to stand or sit for prolonged periods, step, balance, crouch, stoop, kneel, squat, bend, occasionally lift heavy objects up to 30 lbs. with or without reasonable accommodations, reach above shoulders, or as needed to complete tasksMust be able to occasionally climb stairs or a ladder to complete tasksPosition located in a combination of production, laboratory, and office environments and requires a tolerance for consistent cold work environments (-10-40˚ F), high worker traffic, loud noises, odors, dust, and varying room temperatures. Fast paced work environment, with multiple sites
The starting annual base pay for this role is between USD $95,000 and $110,000. The actual base is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. The role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, and benefits.

title: Advanced Billing Specialist
description:
Quincy, IL

Job Summary

The Order Management Advanced Billing Specialist will manage the customer experience in Americas by handling and supporting all operational transactions for Industrial Technologies businesses. The role is critical in driving awareness and channel engagement within milestone billing as it relates to sales. The role will also help to drive our strategic initiatives through things such as pricing, customer satisfaction and service levels.

Responsibilities

Strong experience in a customer facing role / previous exposure to the Service Industry preferred. Self-motivated, assertive individual and teamwork oriented. Understanding of operations and the supply demand flow is beneficial. Problem solving: Demonstrates the ability to identify the most important elements that influence a problem and the ability to work through a series of operations to determine a logical solution. Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions. Probes all fruitful sources for answers and doesn't stop at the first answers. Change agent: Questions accepted practices, develops creative approaches, mitigates resistance to change and encourages others to do the same to promote progress through change. Previous experience conducting training is an advantage. Customer Advocate: Cultivates strong, mutually beneficial customer relationships and works to earn the trust of the customer by ensuring that the company delivers value and acquires customer-driven insights to effectively address issues, needs and opportunities. Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to build strategic relationships within various levels of customer’s organization. Communication: Understands and communicates technical information. Writes and speaks clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles. 

Basic Qualification

Act as key liaison between territory Channel Partners for North America CTS and non-territory-based manufacturing to ensure timely delivery of goods for customers and channel partners. Manage customer expectations by clearly communicating our commitments (i.e. delivery dates or problem resolution), and keeping channel partners informed of status of orders, issues, etc. Coach Distributors and internal teams on advanced billing process and develop relationships with key accounts/distribution partners. Manage Sales Order bookings / backlog in relation to dates / holds / quotes and P.O. errors as needed. Ensure that all requested support is provided to meet monthly revenue target, while driving order processing consistency within the channels. Provide high quality service through efficient use of all Oracle/CRM functionalities related to order fulfillment and relative to customer activity, while coordinating cancellation requests with supplier/customer in order to avoid any discrepancy / excess in inventory. Process all Progress/Advance (milestone) Billings Sales Orders for internal and external channel partners. Submit invoices to customer. Enter orders for key/strategic accounts. Manage orders dates. Manage invoice disputes. Support portal administration. Manage customer orders from placement to invoicing through multiple channels, including phone, fax, EDI, E-Mail, and websites to ensure 100% customer satisfaction. Support internal/external audits with record retention, monthly reconciliation reports, and manage change order requests to ensure accurate invoicing. Improve First Pass Yield of order details by working with cross functional team to provide timely and accurate information. 

Key Competencies

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Marketing or Supply Chain preferred. Minimum of 2 years higher education and /or 1-2+ year experience in customer facing role required. Proficient in MS Office applications and experience with ERP. Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional projects and people without direct authority. High attention to detail and organizational skills. Proficient in Excel

title: CNC Machine Operator - 2nd Shift
description:
CNC Machine Operator

2nd shift Mon-Fri 4:00pm - 12:30am

Pay Starts at $21/hr. and can go up based upon experience!

Shift differential for 2nd shift based on experience!

CNC Machine Operator – 2nd Shift

Onsite at Alsip IL

About Us

Job Summary

As a Manufacturing Cell Operator, you'll be an integral part of our team, contributing to the success of our lean manufacturing environment. We're seeking reliable individuals with the ability to read blueprints, maintain tight tolerances, and demonstrate a strong mechanical aptitude. Join us in making Alsip, IL a thriving workplace for both our team and our company!

Responsibilities

 Follow Standard Work for machine setup, running parts, and preventative maintenance. Inspect, deburr, and perform manual operations or operate additional equipment. Update and maintain visual controls. Support countermeasures and engage in SMED, Kaizen events, and '5 Whys' problem-solving. Operate and maintain a clean, safe environment. Identify and report equipment abnormalities. Adhere to company safety procedures and standards. Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications

 2+ years in machining or equivalent education in a related field with basic math and computer skills. High School Diploma or GED equivalent; Trade school certification in a related field is preferred. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and proficient in speaking and reading English. Proven ability to set up and operate CNC machining work centers, specializing in tool changes and in-process offset adjustments. Effective use of metrology equipment for precise measurements. Strong blueprint reading skills with a comprehensive understanding of GD & T. Proficiency in CNC machinery (mills/lathes) and CNC controls such as Fanuc, Siemens, Okuma.

Travel & Work Arrangements/Requirements

Fully site based

Key Competencies

 The position is classified as onsite, working in an industrial manufacturing environment, with exposure to noise, heat, cold, fumes, and chemicals. Ability to lift a maximum of 40 lbs. Ability to walk and stand for extended periods. Exposure to noise, heat, cold, fumes, and chemicals within a manufacturing environment.

Union Relationship

We are a proud partner with District No. 8 of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers with a closed shop. All hourly employees are union members.

 New employees are regarded as probationary for the first 60 working days of their employment. After probation, the employee will join the union with an initiation fee and monthly dues. Full benefits package and company-paid pension

title: Truck Shop Technician B (2nd Shift) $5000.00 S/O Bonus
description:
About The Company

Republic Services, Inc. (NYSE: RSG) is a leader in the environmental services industry. We provide customers with the most complete set of products and services, including recycling, waste, special waste, hazardous waste and field services. Our industry-leading commitments to advance circularity and support decarbonization are helping deliver on our vision to partner with customers to create a more sustainable world.

In 2023, Republic’s total company revenue was $14.9 billion, and adjusted EBITDA was $4.4 billion. We serve 13 million customers and operate more than 1,000 locations, including collection and transfer stations, recycling and polymer centers, treatment facilities, and landfills.

Although we operate across North America, the collection, recycling, treatment, or disposal of materials is a local business, and the dynamics and opportunities differ in each market we serve. By combining local operational management with standardized business practices, we drive greater operating efficiencies across the company while maintaining day-to-day operational decisions at the local level, closest to the customer.

Our customers, including small businesses, major corporations and municipalities, want a partner with the expertise and capabilities to effectively manage their multiple recycling and waste streams. They choose Republic Services because we are committed to exceeding their expectations and helping them achieve their sustainability goals. Our 41,000 team members understand that it's not just what we do that matters, but how we do it.

Our Company Values Guide Our Daily Actions

Safe: We protect the livelihoods of our colleagues and communities.Committed to Serve: We go above and beyond to exceed our customers’ expectations.Environmentally Responsible: We take action to improve our environment.Driven: We deliver results in the right way.Human-Centered: We respect the dignity and unique potential of every person.

We are proud of our high employee engagement score of 86. We have an inclusive and diverse culture where every voice counts. In addition, our team positively impacted 4.6 million people in 2023 through the Republic Services Charitable Foundation and local community grants. These projects are designed to meet the specific needs of the communities we serve, with a focus on building sustainable neighborhoods.

STRATEGY

Republic Services’ strategy is designed to generate profitable growth. Through acquisitions and industry advancements, we safely and sustainably manage our customers’ multiple waste streams through a North American footprint of vertically integrated assets.

We focus on three areas of growth to meet the increasing needs of our customers: recycling and waste, environmental solutions and sustainability innovation.

With our integrated approach, strengthening our position in one area advances other areas of our business. For example, as we grow volume in recycling and waste, we collect additional material to bolster our circularity capabilities. And as we expand environmental solutions, we drive additional opportunities to provide these services to our existing recycling and waste customers.

Recycling and Waste

We continue to expand our recycling and waste business footprint throughout North America through organic growth and targeted acquisitions. The 13 million customers we serve and our more than 5 million pick-ups per day provide us with a distinct advantage. We aggregate materials at scale, unlocking new opportunities for advanced recycling. In addition, we are cross-selling new products and services to better meet our customers’ specific needs.

Environmental Solutions

Our comprehensive environmental solutions capabilities help customers safely manage their most technical waste streams. We are expanding both our capabilities and our geographic footprint. We see strong growth opportunities for our offerings, including PFAS remediation, an increasing customer need.

SUSTAINABILITY INNOVATION

Republic’s recent innovations to advance circularity and decarbonization demonstrate our unique ability to leverage sustainability as a platform for growth.

The Republic Services Polymer Center is the nation’s first integrated plastics recycling facility. This innovative site processes rigid plastics from our recycling centers, producing recycled materials that promote true bottle-to-bottle circularity. We also formed Blue Polymers, a joint venture with Ravago, to develop facilities that will further process plastic material from our Polymer Centers to help meet the growing demand for sustainable packaging. We are building a network of Polymer Centers and Blue Polymer facilities across North America.

We continue to advance decarbonization at our landfills. As demand for renewable energy continues to grow, we have 70 landfill gas-to-energy projects in operation and plan to expand our portfolio to 115 projects by 2028.

RECENT RECOGNITION

title: Senior Portfolio Manager (REMOTE)
description:
At DICK’S Sporting Goods, we believe in how positively sports can change lives. On our team, everyone plays a critical role in creating confidence and excitement by personally equipping all athletes to achieve their dreams. We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workforce, reflecting the communities we serve.

If you are ready to make a difference as part of the world’s greatest sports team, apply to join our team today!

Overview

At Dick’s Sporting Goods, the Sr. Portfolio Manager role is critical in delivering success for our athletes and teammates and will help to enable and deliver next generation retail technology! This role can be focused on a number of exciting and innovative areas including Ecommerce, Marketing, Omni-channel, Merchandising and Pricing, Supply Chain, Corporate Systems, Security and Infrastructure, Platform Engineering, Architecture, and others! If you love to inspire and innovate, please join us!

The Sr. Portfolio Manager leads the planning, oversight, and coordination of all portfolios within or across multiple domain area and facilitates cross domain alignment and coordination as needed. Partners with product managers and others on intake and demand planning. Engages all disciplines across the technology team to facilitate capacity planning and alignment of capacity to demand through planning, prioritization, sequencing of work, and dependency mapping. Utilizes defined practices, tools, and deliverables to track and report on the overall health and progress of delivery against portfolio plans and goals. Ownership for maturing multiple practices, deliverables and/or tools within the portfolio practice. Also acts as a mentor and coach to portfolio managers.

Job Duties & Responsibilities

Portfolio Management

Lead the production and approval and management of portfolio plans to ensure integration of activities across portfolios and domains, appropriately organized to deliver on defined objectives, comply with the organization's approved methodologies, frameworks, and standards and compliance with the organization's wider governance structure and processes.Drive and mature the activation of annual, quarterly and continuous planning activities across multiple portfolios including managing intake, dependency mapping, prioritization, sequencing of work, and WIP limits.Act as a strategic though leader by bringing actionable insights and trends as opposed to after the fact reporting.Specify and lead the delivery of the portfolio review processes to ensure that stakeholders can evaluate progress against plans and agree on change at appropriate points.Ensure that risks, issues, dependencies, and constraints are managed appropriately at portfolio and domain levels. Where risks or issues threaten delivery of commitments within the portfolio, develop and agree recovery plans.Develop and implement stakeholder engagement strategies and plans across multiple portfolios and domains to identify relevant stakeholders, to create mutually supportive working relationships, and to ensure that each stakeholder has an appropriate share of voice across assigned portfolio(s).Ensure that roles and responsibilities are clearly defined within portfolio management decision-making structures and processes.Use structured change management methodologies to drive acceptance of change and to embed desired culture and behaviors.Interpret business needs and identify solution recommendations to business problems.Act as SME in portfolio management discipline and develop own and more junior team member capabilities by participating in assessment and development planning activities as well as formal and informal training and coaching; gain or maintain external professional accreditation where relevant to improve performance and fulfill personal potential. Maintain an in-depth understanding of technology, external regulation, and industry best practices through ongoing education, attending conferences, and reading specialist media.

Talent Development

Identify organizational needs and recruit for open positionsBuild the Agile practices practice and continuously evolve team process standards to drive quality and efficienciesSet clear performance standards for teammatesCoach and ensure all teammates are getting the training and education needed to develop professionally

Ongoing Learning And Development

Act as subject matter expert in an area of technology, policy, regulation, or operational management for the team and beyond in the function. Maintain external accreditations and in-depth understanding of current and emerging technologies, external regulation, and industry best practices through continuing professional development, attending conferences, and reading specialist media.

Continuous Improvement

Review existing operations in own area of work and implement innovation processes to generate new ideas and ensure continuous improvements are delivered.

Culture of Innovation

Define the execution plan to disseminate innovative capabilities across the businesses, helping people develop these competencies and enabling them to innovate through solutions such as idea generation platforms, jam sessions, and hackathons.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree7-10 years of relevant work experience , with 2-4 years experience in a retail and eCommerce environment.Experience translating ideas, approaches, and dependencies between technical and functional team members2-4 years of experience with agile development and deployment practices, agile-based tools and practicesExperience communicating program status, risks, issues, and needs to senior leaders, and managing upExperience and knowledge in portfolio management best practices, principles, methodologies and toolsProficient in mentoring and coaching growing team members in a professional settingExperience managing alignment across programs, projects or product teams in an enterprise environmentStrong communication and presentation skillsExperience managing strategic vendor relationships or acting as the primary point of contact for strategic partnershipsProficient in effective troubleshooting and issue resolution techniquesProficient in the planning and execution of programs and projects and risk mitigation strategiesAbility to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiencesProficient in program management execution in a modern software environment via multiple methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, etc)Strong Experience using Microsoft Office tools (Project, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project)Experience with lean portfolio managementStrong partnering skills by building effective relationships with business leaders along with the ability to deliver executive-level presentations, briefings, and summaries.Experience working in or with a product and design teamsPreferred experience with planning/road mapping tools like Aha and Monday.com and Jira AlignDesired Skills:Good Knowledge of Retail E-Commerce DomainPMP CertificationExposure to a CI/CD toolchainDegree in Organizational Development, Organizational Behavior, or Industrial/Organizational Psychology;Understanding of modern microservice-based architectures and methodologiesOCM or Change Management Professional CertificationExperience with Agile Development and knowledge on Agile Deployment practicesGood Knowledge of Retail E-Commerce DomainPMP CertificationExposure to a CI/CD toolchainDegree in Organizational Development, Organizational Behavior, or Industrial/Organizational Psychology;Understanding of modern microservice-based architectures and methodologiesOCM or Change Management Professional CertificationExperience with Agile Development and knowledge on Agile Deployment practices

title: Lead AWS Platform Engineer - REMOTE
description:
Job Description

We currently have a career opportunity for a Lead AWS Platform Engineer. While our headquarters location is St. Louis, MO, this position is remote and can be based anywhere within the United States and will be working EST zones.

Perficient is always looking for the best and brightest talent and we need you! We’re a quickly-growing, global digital consulting leader, and we’re transforming the world’s largest enterprises and biggest brands. You’ll work with the latest technologies, expand your skills, and become a part of our global community of talented, diverse, and knowledgeable colleagues.

We are seeking a highly motivated Lead AWS Platform Engineer to join our team. This unique role blends the responsibilities of infrastructure architect, DevOps engineer, and cloud systems engineer. You'll play a pivotal role in supporting the development and implementation of a new workflow utilizing SageMaker and GitHub Actions.

Perficient is always looking for the best and brightest talent and we need you! We’re a quickly-growing, global digital consulting leader, and we’re transforming the world’s largest enterprises and biggest brands. You’ll work with the latest technologies, expand your skills, and become a part of our global community of talented, diverse, and knowledgeable colleagues.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement secure and scalable cloud infrastructure solutions to support our platform engineering initiatives. Champion DevSecOps practices, automating workflows and integrating CI/CD pipelines with a focus on SageMaker and GitHub Actions (familiarity with GitLab and Jenkins a plus). Manage and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform for efficient provisioning and management of AWS resources. Configure and manage container image repositories using Amazon ECR and Artifactory. Secure and manage access controls using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). Design and manage cloud databases, including relational (RDS), data warehouses (Redshift), NoSQL (DynamoDB), and object storage (S3) solutions on AWS. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure optimal integration between infrastructure and application development. Troubleshoot and resolve cloud infrastructure related issues proactively. 

Qualifications

Minimum 10 years of experienceMust have & + years of experience in designing and implementing cloud infrastructure solutions on AWS. Proven understanding of DevSecOps principles and methodologies. Expertise in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform. Proficiency in container image repositories like Amazon ECR and Artifactory. Strong understanding of AWS services including IAM, RDS, Redshift, DynamoDB, S3, etc. Experience with CI/CD tools, particularly GitHub Actions (familiarity with GitLab and Jenkins a plus). Experience with SageMaker is a strong plus. Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. 

Additional skills:

Experience with container orchestration tools (e.g., Docker Swarm, Kubernetes). Experience with cloud cost optimization strategies. Experience scripting languages like Python or Bash for automation. 

Preferred education and certification:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related fieldAWS certified DevOps Engineer Professional or AWS certified Developer Associate

It is not typical for a candidate to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the unique facts and circumstances regarding each candidate. Please note that the salary range posted reflects the base salary only and does not include benefits or any potential equity or variable bonus programs. Information regarding the benefits available for this position are in our benefits overview .

Who We Are

Perficient is a leading global digital consultancy. We imagine, create, engineer, and run digital transformation solutions that help our clients exceed customers’ expectations, outpace competition, and grow their business. With unparalleled strategy, creative, and technology capabilities, our colleagues bring big thinking and innovative ideas, along with a practical approach to help our clients – the world’s largest enterprises and biggest brands succeed.

What We Believe

At Perficient, we promise to challenge, champion, and celebrate our people. You will experience a unique and collaborative culture that values every voice. Join our team, and you’ll become part of something truly special.

We believe in developing a workforce that is as diverse and inclusive as the clients we work with. We’re committed to actively listening, learning, and acting to further advance our organization, our communities, and our future leaders… and we’re not done yet.

description:

Pay Starts at $22.03/hr. and can go up based upon experience!

Machinist - 2nd Shift

Job Summary

Set up and operate conventional, special purpose, and computer numerical control (CNC) machines and Machining centers to fabricate metallic and non-metallic parts. The responsibilities of the Machinist I include the following job duties. The responsibilities are not limited to these tasks.

Responsibilities

 Follow all safety requirements; demonstrate working knowledge and safe operation of equipment and machines. Follow all ISO procedures and safety rules, including wearing personal safety equipment. Meet or exceed established set-up times and production rates. Check quality to ensure parts produced meet print specifications. Set up and operate CNC lathes, milling machines, and grinders when required. Adjust cutters, demonstrate safe use of cutting fluids, and utilize proper metal removal techniques to minimize chip creation and optimize material yield. Perform in process inspections using micrometers, calipers, indicators, height stands, plug/pin gages, and other standard inspection tools. Actively participate in problem solving and continuous improvement events. Follow all company policies and procedures as mandated by the Human Resources department.Other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications

 Language skills: read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating maintenance instructions, blueprints, drawings, etc. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence and effectively present information to other employees. Mathematical skills: Basic shop math; add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Must be able to use basic hand tools and lift 35 lbs. High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) required; (secondary education is a plus). Minimum 1 year of machining experience or Technical College equivalent.

 High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) required; (secondary education is a plus). Minimum 1 year of machining experience or Technical College equivalent.

title: OnSite Environmental Technician I
description:
About The Company

Republic Services, Inc. (NYSE: RSG) is a leader in the environmental services industry. We provide customers with the most complete set of products and services, including recycling, waste, special waste, hazardous waste and field services. Our industry-leading commitments to advance circularity and support decarbonization are helping deliver on our vision to partner with customers to create a more sustainable world.

In 2023, Republic’s total company revenue was $14.9 billion, and adjusted EBITDA was $4.4 billion. We serve 13 million customers and operate more than 1,000 locations, including collection and transfer stations, recycling and polymer centers, treatment facilities, and landfills.

Although we operate across North America, the collection, recycling, treatment, or disposal of materials is a local business, and the dynamics and opportunities differ in each market we serve. By combining local operational management with standardized business practices, we drive greater operating efficiencies across the company while maintaining day-to-day operational decisions at the local level, closest to the customer.

Our customers, including small businesses, major corporations and municipalities, want a partner with the expertise and capabilities to effectively manage their multiple recycling and waste streams. They choose Republic Services because we are committed to exceeding their expectations and helping them achieve their sustainability goals. Our 41,000 team members understand that it's not just what we do that matters, but how we do it.

Our Company Values Guide Our Daily Actions

Safe: We protect the livelihoods of our colleagues and communities.Committed to Serve: We go above and beyond to exceed our customers’ expectations.Environmentally Responsible: We take action to improve our environment.Driven: We deliver results in the right way.Human-Centered: We respect the dignity and unique potential of every person.

We are proud of our high employee engagement score of 86. We have an inclusive and diverse culture where every voice counts. In addition, our team positively impacted 4.6 million people in 2023 through the Republic Services Charitable Foundation and local community grants. These projects are designed to meet the specific needs of the communities we serve, with a focus on building sustainable neighborhoods.

STRATEGY

Republic Services’ strategy is designed to generate profitable growth. Through acquisitions and industry advancements, we safely and sustainably manage our customers’ multiple waste streams through a North American footprint of vertically integrated assets.

We focus on three areas of growth to meet the increasing needs of our customers: recycling and waste, environmental solutions and sustainability innovation.

With our integrated approach, strengthening our position in one area advances other areas of our business. For example, as we grow volume in recycling and waste, we collect additional material to bolster our circularity capabilities. And as we expand environmental solutions, we drive additional opportunities to provide these services to our existing recycling and waste customers.

Recycling and Waste

We continue to expand our recycling and waste business footprint throughout North America through organic growth and targeted acquisitions. The 13 million customers we serve and our more than 5 million pick-ups per day provide us with a distinct advantage. We aggregate materials at scale, unlocking new opportunities for advanced recycling. In addition, we are cross-selling new products and services to better meet our customers’ specific needs.

Environmental Solutions

Our comprehensive environmental solutions capabilities help customers safely manage their most technical waste streams. We are expanding both our capabilities and our geographic footprint. We see strong growth opportunities for our offerings, including PFAS remediation, an increasing customer need.

SUSTAINABILITY INNOVATION

Republic’s recent innovations to advance circularity and decarbonization demonstrate our unique ability to leverage sustainability as a platform for growth.

The Republic Services Polymer Center is the nation’s first integrated plastics recycling facility. This innovative site processes rigid plastics from our recycling centers, producing recycled materials that promote true bottle-to-bottle circularity. We also formed Blue Polymers, a joint venture with Ravago, to develop facilities that will further process plastic material from our Polymer Centers to help meet the growing demand for sustainable packaging. We are building a network of Polymer Centers and Blue Polymer facilities across North America.

We continue to advance decarbonization at our landfills. As demand for renewable energy continues to grow, we have 70 landfill gas-to-energy projects in operation and plan to expand our portfolio to 115 projects by 2028.

RECENT RECOGNITION

Ability to use heavy and light equipment, such as forklift, and pallet-jack. Skilled using hand and shop tools, and instruments. Demonstrates, accuracy, thoroughness and attention to detail. Must be able to prioritize, stay focused and handle multiple, diverse responsibilities. A valid driver’s license may be required for some positions.

title: Sales Coordinator
description:
At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.

Position Summary

The Sales Coordinator’s primary role is to provide order management, backlog management and/or logistics support for Customers and Sales associates in assigned capital equipment value stream in support of the Healthcare business. The individual is responsible for managing orders from quote to delivery through install with direct interaction with Planning, Sales, Manufacturing, Traffic and Service to ensure fulfillment of Customer requirements. The Sales Coordinator will support on-going business operation of Sales associates, ensure requests are met and quality targets are reached and sustained.

This is a hybrid role working out of our headquarters in Mentor, Ohio with Wednesday and Thursday in the office. 

Duties

STERIS liaison for capital equipment business requiring a high level of attention, initiative and follow upResponsible for order and backlog management, including resolving hold issues, and/or logistics coordination through installEnsure all actions are completed in accordance with department policies and proceduresFacilitate the order process for new Customers by completing and submitting credit applications and requests for account setupReview and validate information on purchase orders utilizing the contract review processAccurately and efficiently record pertinent information into Oracle order management systemReview and prepare special billing documentationManage Customer capital and consumables order backlog with daily review and management of scheduled ship dates, investigation and resolution of credit process holds as well as order changes to ensure Customer expectations are met; required to run reports related to the overall management of ordersManage order entry, holds resolution, or logistics coordination in a timely manner to meet Customer requirementsVerify order details are correctly set up and coordinated for product shipment from various plant and vendor locations to designated delivery pointObtain and document all delivery requirements per the Customer’s specificationsCollaborate with Sales, Planning, Credit, Customer Service Management, Logistics and the Customer to resolve outstanding order management issuesProcess and/or revise quotations to ensure GPO contract requirements are met

Duties - cont'd

Assist Sales with processing and forwarding any necessary paperwork including credit applications, quotes, SBW, etc.Provide data to Sales, including, but not limited to, pricing, order status, holds issues, backorders, freight quotes, order consolidation, and delivery informationWork with Planning to ensure availability and timely delivery on capital equipment ordersWork with Traffic to expedite emergency shipments, coordinate deliveries and acquire freight estimatesEnsure orders are consistent with STERIS Terms and Conditions and work with Sales to resolve exceptionsDevelop and maintain business relationship with Customers and Sales while providing excellent Customer ServiceInvestigate product complaints and work with RMA team to ensure timely action and resolutionUtilize available resources to update and increase knowledge on products, systems, procedures and corporate initiativesSupport the continuous improvement initiatives within the function, including standard work and the root-cause-countermeasure process in support of key performance indicators (KPIs) Work within the department’s Lean tracking tools and provide data as needed for monthly documentation of performance against agreed-upon KPIsParticipate in Kaizen events when appropriate and supports the action plans that result from those events Other duties as assigned5% travel possible

Required Experience

title: Waterfront Technician, Machinery Controls System
description:
Responsibilities

The Naval Surface Warface Center Philadelphia (NSWCPD) Machinery Control Systems (MCS) group (Code 552) is seeking a technician to support shipboard testing efforts in support of the DDG HM&E Mid-Life Upgrades Program. The candidate must have experience as an electrical technician, and the ability to troubleshoot control systems with the use of system documentation and electrical schematics. The candidate will be expected to work on a flexible work schedule to ensure priority tasking can be completed in the allotted timeframe. The candidate will be tasked by and report to technical leads within Code 552. The candidate will be expected to provide documented status updates on a regular basis.

Principal Duties/Responsibilities

 Troubleshoot control systems with the use of system documentation and electrical schematics.  Provide test support for all variants of fielded systems at LBES and shipboard.  Provide shipboard software and hardware installation support of all DDG 51 variants of fielded systems at LBES and shipboard.  Provide documented status updates on a regular basis.  Act as a liaison between shipboard test team and technical leads back in Philadelphia  Maintain source information between jobs and tasking.  Aid in test procedure verification, edits, and implementation. 

Required Qualifications

 Experience Required 

 3 to 5 years of experience as an electrical technician, GSE, ET, or ETV.  Experience tracing signals and diagnosing or isolating cause for electrical failures.  Experience with grounded and ungrounded systems. 

Technical Skillsets Required

 Basic electrical troubleshooting skills to include the ability to use a digital multimeter.  Basic electrical principals to include understanding the difference between current, voltage and resistance as well as how to effectively troubleshoot circuits containing them.  Ability to read and understand electrical schematics.  Proficiency with a personal computer (PC)  Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (especially Excel, Word, and Outlook)  The ability to learn new PC applications as needed.  Reasonable problem-solving ability.  Attention to detail and meticulous documentation of testing, troubleshooting steps, and findings. 

Travel

 Regular expected travel frequency away from your permanent location may be up to 30-50%. 

Desired Qualifications

 Advanced Skillsets Desired: 

 Advanced computer skills to include use of HyperTerminal, Putty, or an equivalent serial interface.  Ability to use an oscilloscope and signal generator.  US Navy shipboard experience in engineering department.  Professional written and oral skills are required. 

Special Requirements

 Successful applicants must either have an active government security clearance or the ability to receive approval upon position acceptance.  Must have a valid US passport or the ability to obtain one upon position acceptance.  This position requires 100% onsite workload at Shipyards and Naval Stations. It will be Mandatory to obtain and maintain necessary clearance to both. 

Overview

Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiaries, Noblis ESI , and Noblis MSD tackle the nation's toughest problems and apply advanced solutions to our clients' most critical missions. We bring the best of scientific thought, management, and engineering expertise together in an environment of independence and objectivity to deliver enduring impact on federal missions. Noblis works with a wide range of government clients in the defense, intelligence and federal civil sectors. Learn more at Noblis -About Us

 Why work at a Noblis company? 

Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public. Noblis has won numerous workplace awards . Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace.

 Salary Range Explanation 

 At Noblis we recognize and reward your contributions, provide you with growth opportunities, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, and work-life programs. Our award programs acknowledge employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our service standards. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in our benefit programs. Other offerings may be provided for employees not within this category. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Benefits page on our Careers site. 

 Salary at Noblis is determined by various factors, including but not limited to, the combination of education, certifications, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, internal and external equity, location, and clearance level, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements and applicable employment laws. The projected compensation range for this position  is provided within the posting and  are based on full time status. Part time staff receive a prorated salary based on regularly scheduled hours. The estimated minimum and maximum displayed represents the broadest range for this position (inclusive of high geographic and high clearance requirements), and is just one component of Noblis’ total compensation package for employees. 

 Posted Salary Range 

USD $24.47 - USD $42.84 /Hr.

 Equal Employment Opportunity 

Noblis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race (as well as because of or on the basis of traits historically associated with race, including hair texture, hair type, and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions, genetic factors, military/veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.

Noblis is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Noblis will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact  employee-relations@noblis.org .

description:

Egnyters are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work and to appreciate the many differences that collectively make Egnyte a higher-performing company and a great place to be.

title: Data Scientist III
description:
Job Description

Target PR Range: 40-60/hr

Depending one experience

Seeking a highly motivated and driven data scientist to join our Quantitative, Translational & ADME Sciences (QTAS) team in North Chicago, IL. The QTAS organization supports the discovery and early clinical pipeline through mechanistically investigating how drug molecules are absorbed, distributed, excreted, metabolized, and transported across the body to predict duration and intensity of exposure and pharmacological action of drug candidates in humans. Digital workflows, systems, IT infrastructure, and computational sciences are critical and growing components within the organization to help deliver vital results in the early pipeline. This specific job role is designed to act as an SME (subject matter expert) for data science within the technical organization of QTAS.

For this role, the successful candidate will have a substantial background in data and computer science with an emphasis on supporting, developing and implementing IT solutions for lab-based systems as well as utilizing computational methods. The candidate should possess a deep knowledge in AI/ML, with a focus on both supervised (like neural networks, decision trees) and unsupervised learning techniques (such as clustering, PCA). They must be adept at applying these methods to large datasets for predictive modeling; in this context- drug properties and discovery patterns in ADME datasets. Proficiency in model validation, optimization, and feature engineering is essential to ensure accuracy and robustness in predictions. The role requires effective collaboration with interdisciplinary teams to integrate AI insights into drug development processes. Strong communication skills are necessary to convey complex AI/ML concepts to a diverse audience.

Key Responsibilities

 Provide business-centric support of IT systems and platforms in support of our scientific operations and processes. Develop, implement, troubleshoot and support solutions independently for the digital infrastructure and workflows within QTAS including custom platform/coding solutions, visualization tools, integration of new software/hardware, and analysis and troubleshooting support. Lead the analysis of large ADME-related datasets, contributing to the understanding and optimization of drug absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion properties. Apply computational tools and machine learning/deep learning techniques to analyze and interpret complex biological data relevant to drug discovery. Develop predictive models and algorithms for identifying potential drug candidates with desirable ADME properties. Collaborate with teams across biological sciences and drug discovery to integrate computational insights into practical drug development strategies. Communicate findings and strategic input to cross-functional teams, including Translational Science, Medicine, and Late Development groups.

Qualifications

 Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Computational Chemistry, or related relevant discipline typically with 8 to 12 (BS), 4 to 8 (MS), or 0 to 4 (Ph.D.) years related industry experience. Passion for data analysis, solving technical problems and applying new technologies to further scientific goals. Strong proficiency in programming (e.g., SQL, Python, R, MATLAB), database technologies (Oracle, mySQL, relational databases; graph databases are a plus), machine learning/deep learning (network architectures are a plus), dimensionality reduction techniques (e.g., PCA), and possible cheminformatics software suites Demonstrated experience in the analysis and visualization of large datasets. Proficiency in any of the following technologies is valued: Python (including libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, Bokeh), JavaScript, Julia, Java/Scala, or R (including Shiny). Comfortable working in cloud and high-performance computational environments (e.g., AWS and Oracle Cloud) Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively in interdisciplinary teams. Understanding of pharma R&D process and challenges in drug discovery is preferred. Proven ability to work in a team environment; ability to work well in a collaborative fast-paced team environment. Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to convey IT related notions to cross-disciplinary scientists. Thorough theoretical and practical understanding of own scientific discipline Background and/or experience in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, biology, or chemistry fields is preferred.

Key Leadership Competencies

 Builds strong relationships with peers and cross-functionally with partners outside of team to enable higher performance. Learns fast, grasps the "essence" and can change course quickly where indicated. Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo. Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement. Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality.CO/NYC candidates might not be considered
The Planet Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Build to Rent Regional Property Manager
description:
Job Description Summary

As a Regional Property Manager (Build to Rent) working for Taylor Morrison’s Yardly Brand team you will manage and oversee the regional portfolio of properties managed by Taylor Morrison’s preferred third-party property management partners. You will be responsible for establishing a Yardly property management best practices playbook and implementing with our partners to ensure outstanding execution at each community. You will coordinate lease-up strategies with all Yardly and property management stakeholders overseeing lease-up budgets, working with marketing personnel, and monitoring pricing strategies to achieve timing objectives and position each community to achieve maximum exit valuations if sold.

Job Details

What You’ll Do

management partners to ensure consistencyEnsure proper staff training, supervision and follow through is being executed by property management companiesSupervise property management companies with feedback regarding staff performance and developmentSupervise facilities access and security protocols for residents and property management agentsParticipate in the development of resident programs and the development of consumer surveysReview and optimize budgets provided by the property management company seeking efficiencies to limit expenses and maximize net operating incomeProvide creative solutions and ideas that will help differentiate Yardly from competitorsProvide guidance to local third-party property management teams to ensure proper resolution to all complaints and maintain a high-level of resident satisfactionEnsure proper compliance of property management standards with applicable lawsManage the preparation, establishment, and operation of project level legal entitiesDevelop property marketing strategies including search engines and social media in conjunction with Yardly marketing personnel and outside partnersSupervise all contracts entered into by a community and make sure a competitive bid process is being utilized Ensure proper maintenance, housekeeping and service standards are being executed by management companies that is inclusive of pools, clubhouse and fitness facilitiesCoordinate with appropriate operation teams on community needs or requests and timing of construction activities that impact lease-upManage weekly calls with local Yardly operations teams and property management personnelUnderstand community technology partners and development timelines to ensure residents enjoy all associated benefits without delayMonthly analysis and review of property financial statements with summarized communication of results to senior managementCoordinate with Acquisition, Purchasing and Accounting department on development title: Dispatcher - Logistics Analyst
description:
About The Company

Republic Services, Inc. (NYSE: RSG) is a leader in the environmental services industry. We provide customers with the most complete set of products and services, including recycling, waste, special waste, hazardous waste and field services. Our industry-leading commitments to advance circularity and support decarbonization are helping deliver on our vision to partner with customers to create a more sustainable world.

In 2023, Republic’s total company revenue was $14.9 billion, and adjusted EBITDA was $4.4 billion. We serve 13 million customers and operate more than 1,000 locations, including collection and transfer stations, recycling and polymer centers, treatment facilities, and landfills.

Although we operate across North America, the collection, recycling, treatment, or disposal of materials is a local business, and the dynamics and opportunities differ in each market we serve. By combining local operational management with standardized business practices, we drive greater operating efficiencies across the company while maintaining day-to-day operational decisions at the local level, closest to the customer.

Our customers, including small businesses, major corporations and municipalities, want a partner with the expertise and capabilities to effectively manage their multiple recycling and waste streams. They choose Republic Services because we are committed to exceeding their expectations and helping them achieve their sustainability goals. Our 41,000 team members understand that it's not just what we do that matters, but how we do it.

Our Company Values Guide Our Daily Actions

Safe: We protect the livelihoods of our colleagues and communities.Committed to Serve: We go above and beyond to exceed our customers’ expectations.Environmentally Responsible: We take action to improve our environment.Driven: We deliver results in the right way.Human-Centered: We respect the dignity and unique potential of every person.

We are proud of our high employee engagement score of 86. We have an inclusive and diverse culture where every voice counts. In addition, our team positively impacted 4.6 million people in 2023 through the Republic Services Charitable Foundation and local community grants. These projects are designed to meet the specific needs of the communities we serve, with a focus on building sustainable neighborhoods.

STRATEGY

Republic Services’ strategy is designed to generate profitable growth. Through acquisitions and industry advancements, we safely and sustainably manage our customers’ multiple waste streams through a North American footprint of vertically integrated assets.

We focus on three areas of growth to meet the increasing needs of our customers: recycling and waste, environmental solutions and sustainability innovation.

With our integrated approach, strengthening our position in one area advances other areas of our business. For example, as we grow volume in recycling and waste, we collect additional material to bolster our circularity capabilities. And as we expand environmental solutions, we drive additional opportunities to provide these services to our existing recycling and waste customers.

Recycling and Waste

We continue to expand our recycling and waste business footprint throughout North America through organic growth and targeted acquisitions. The 13 million customers we serve and our more than 5 million pick-ups per day provide us with a distinct advantage. We aggregate materials at scale, unlocking new opportunities for advanced recycling. In addition, we are cross-selling new products and services to better meet our customers’ specific needs.

Environmental Solutions

Our comprehensive environmental solutions capabilities help customers safely manage their most technical waste streams. We are expanding both our capabilities and our geographic footprint. We see strong growth opportunities for our offerings, including PFAS remediation, an increasing customer need.

SUSTAINABILITY INNOVATION

Republic’s recent innovations to advance circularity and decarbonization demonstrate our unique ability to leverage sustainability as a platform for growth.

The Republic Services Polymer Center is the nation’s first integrated plastics recycling facility. This innovative site processes rigid plastics from our recycling centers, producing recycled materials that promote true bottle-to-bottle circularity. We also formed Blue Polymers, a joint venture with Ravago, to develop facilities that will further process plastic material from our Polymer Centers to help meet the growing demand for sustainable packaging. We are building a network of Polymer Centers and Blue Polymer facilities across North America.

We continue to advance decarbonization at our landfills. As demand for renewable energy continues to grow, we have 70 landfill gas-to-energy projects in operation and plan to expand our portfolio to 115 projects by 2028.
